Helmin J. Caba, Mayor

Mayor Helmin J. Caba has lived in Perth Amboy since 1977, and considers it a blessing to have grown up in our historical City of Perth Amboy. He believes that his faith and family upbringing molded him into a stronger person physically and mentally. Mayor Caba and his wife Wendy are lifelong residents and homeowners. They are the proud parents of their son Adam and daughter Audrey.

Mayor Caba was born in La Vega Province of the Dominican Republic in 1973. After emigrating from the Dominican Republic, His parents, Jorge and Gladys Caba, instilled upon him the importance of hard work and the feeling that no matter how successful you are you have a responsibility to help others. His parents led by example in achieving the American dream they so solidly embraced. They became American citizens and worked multiple jobs to support their family.

Mayor Caba has deep, strong roots in Perth Amboy, and is a member of the Most Holy Name of Jesus Parish. Striving to empower those around him, Mayor Caba has a long history of community activism and volunteerism. He cares deeply about our future and is committed to work as hard as necessary to make our city a better place to live and work. As a community leader that has experience in different fields, he brings fresh vision and renewed energy to Perth Amboy government.

  • Former City of Perth Amboy Councilman (2016-2020)
  • Chairman of the Perth Amboy Democratic Organization
  • PADO committeeman for Ward/District 1-1
  • Former Paraprofessional at Perth Amboy High School
  • Former Union Member / American Federation of Teachers (AFT) member for the Perth Amboy School District
  • Former Board member of the Perth Amboy Arts Council
  • Former Board member of the Perth Amboy Municipal Alliance
  • Former Board member of the Perth Amboy Catholic Schools Advisory Council
  • Former board member of the Perth Amboy Historical Preservation Commission
  • Former Member of The Citizens Campaign Organization
  • Former President of the Latin-American Softball League for 10 years
  • Alumni of Holy Trinity Catholic School
  • Graduate from Perth Amboy High School (1991)
  • Graduate of Middlesex County College with high honors in Marketing and Advertising, and moved onto School of Visual Arts in NYC
  • Alumni of Phi Theta Kappa Honor Society
  • Entrepreneur / Former owner of Fine-Line Hair Studio, Healthy Choice Grill Restaurant and Forever Young School Uniforms.
  • Member of the Most Holy Name of Jesus Parish in Perth Amboy, NJ

For a copy of Mayor Caba's bio, click here

    Office of the Mayor

    • Office of the Mayor
    • Office Staff Directory
    • Request a Meeting
    • Send an Invitation
    • Request a Citation/Proclamation/Flag Raising
    Office of the Mayor
    The Office of the Mayor encompasses the Mayor's executive staff, including Chief of Staff of the Mayor's Office, Mayor's Aide, Executive Assistant, and  Communication staff. The office arranges special programs, annual initiatives, and public communications.

    Mayor Helmin J. Caba serves as the chief executive and administrative officer of the city while overseeing all city departments, enforcing the charter and ordinances of the City and via departments recommends legislative actions and policies. 
    Office Staff Directory
    Name Phone Number
     Lisett Lebron, Chief of Staff (732) 826-0290 Ext. 4005
    Miguel A. Arocho, Mayor's Aide (732) 881-7991
     Isamar Payano, Confidential Aide (732) 826-0290 Ext. 4003
     Myrna Aldea-Febles, Account Clerk (732) 826-0290 Ext. 4002

    Request a Meeting
    All meeting requests with the Mayor must be submitted in writing and via email to mayorsoffice@perthamboynj.org. 

    Office Hours are from 9:00 a.m.- 5:00 p.m.  However, an after-hours meeting may be accommodated.  
    Send an Invitation
    All invitations requesting Mayor's attendance must be submitted in writing and via email to mayorsoffice@perthamboynj.org. 
    Request a Citation/Proclamation/Flag Raising
    If you would like to request a citation or proclamation from the Mayor, please email your request to: mayorsoffice@perthamboynj.org. 

    Details on documentation needed for preparation will be provided after your inquiry is received. 

    Historic City of Perth Amboy

    Perth Amboy, an urban community with a rich cultural history and a more than 300 year old maritime and industrial legacy. The City comprises a land area of 4.55 square miles with a population of 50,814 according to the 2010 Census.

    City Hall

    260 High Street, Perth Amboy, NJ 08861
    Open Map >

    New Call for Artists: Black History Month Exhibit

    Call for Artists: Black History Month Exhibit
    The Perth Amboy Gallery Center for the Arts is now accepting artist submissions for the upcoming Black History Month Exhibit. Artists working in all visual art disciplines are encouraged to apply.
    Application deadline: January 31.

    Apply here:
    https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSf9SXITMTwR06Nd4wd5CYLpRwzNtQbmMKow-zJJnzDntmJCCA/viewform

    Exhibit details and guidelines:
    https://www.perthamboynj.org/community/news/announcements/call_for_artists___black_history_month_exhibit

    New UEZ Forgivable Loan Program for Small Business

    UEZ Forgivable Loan Program for Small Business

    The City of Perth Amboys Urban Enterprise Zone Forgivable Loan Program application opens on Thursday, January 22, 2026, at 10:00 a.m., providing up to $50,000 in financial assistance to eligible small businesses. IMPORTANT: Applications will be reviewed on a first-come, first-served basis, and while funds are available.

    Business owners can:

    • Learn more about the loan program and prepare apply on January 22nd:
      https://www.perthamboynj.org/cms/One.aspx?portalId=11205008&pageId=21144164

    • Watch the recorded webinar in preparation for the application opening:
      https://youtu.be/5MYWMYh1S-4

    • Learn more about the UEZ program:
      https://www.perthamboynj.org/cms/One.aspx?portalId=11205008&pageId=12071488

    New Safe Housing Grant Available for Seniors

    Safe Housing Grant Available for Seniors

    Perth Amboy homeowners age 60 and older may qualify for up to $2,000 in essential home safety repairs through the Residential Maintenance Safe Housing Grant.

    Applications are available at the Alexander F. Jankowski Community Center, Office on Aging, 1 Olive Street, 1st Floor. Applications are accepted while funds are available.

    Learn more and view program details

    New 2026 Garbage Collection Holiday Schedule

    The 2026 Garbage Collection Holiday Schedule (No Service Days) is now available. Download here.

    New Temporary Pause on Online Payments

    Notice: Temporary Pause on Online Payments

    Online payment services for City accounts are temporarily unavailable due to a scheduled system update.

    Online payments are expected to resume on January 17, 2026.

    We appreciate your patience and understanding. For questions, please contact the Tax & Water Department.

    Aviso: Suspensin Temporal de Pagos en Lnea

    Los servicios de pago en lnea para cuentas de la Ciudad no estn disponibles temporalmente debido a una actualizacin programada del sistema.

    Se espera que los pagos en lnea se reanuden el 17 de enero de 2026.

    Agradecemos su paciencia y comprensin. Para preguntas, comunquese con el Departamento de Impuestos y Agua.
